name: European Banking Institute
goal: The EBI is a research hub resulting from the joint venture of 31 European academic institutions from 20 countries, which aim to partner in the fields of banking regulation and supervision in Europe, and to fuel the dialogue between regulators, supervisors and industry representatives in these fields. For this purpose, regulars events and seminars/workshops are organised in the main locations of the EU decision makers as well as locally in the Member States. Academic research orientated to the topics which currently matter to the regulators/supervisors and to the industry is also being fostered through Working Papers Series and sponsored research programmes.
interests: Banking and financial services, Education and training
euInitiatives: Banking Union; Prudential Regulation and Supervision; Resolution; Capital Markets Union; Digitalisation and FinTech/RegTech; Corporate Governance; Sustainable Finance
